episode_title: 720 - The One With Rachel’s Big Kiss

content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Monica, and Rachel are sitting on the couch and Ross is sitting on the chair, and they’re all talking.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Out of all of us, who do you think is gonna get married next?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Probably Monica and Chandler.
(A woman walks up to Gunther in the background.)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi. Could I have a pack of Newport Lights , please?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Oh umm, uh we don’t sell cigarettes, but they have them at the newsstand across the street. (Points.)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: That’d be great, thanks. (Gunther goes and gets them.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, Melissa Warburton. I don’t think I have the energy for this.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Oh my God! Ray-ray Green?! (Screams)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Melissa!

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: You have been M.I.A for the past seven sorority newsletters, what’s up with you?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh—(Turns and looks at the gang who’s staring)—Why don’t I tell you over here? (She walks Melissa away from the gang.)

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: So last I heard you were gonna get married. (Grabs Rachel’s hand and notices that she doesn’t have a ring on it.) (Sadly) Oh poor Ray-ray.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no-no, no! It’s good! It’s all good! I-I actually work at Ralph Lauren !

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Shut up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I will not! I’m the divisional head of men’s sportswear!

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Oh shut up more! Now, are you friends with Ralph?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh please…

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Are you?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Listen, we-we have to have dinner. What-what are you doing tomorrow night?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh tomorrow, oh I don’t know. Um…

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: You do now. You’re having dinner with me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Shut up.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: I-I’ve got to go. This has been so great Ray-ray! (Gunther returns with her cigarettes.) Oh, there you are. (Takes them from Gunther.) (To Rachel) Umm, so listen, just call me. Here’s my card. (Hands the card over.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, wow thanks! (Reading the card) Oh you’re in real estate!

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Oh no, that’s-that’s an old card. Umm, I wanted to get out of that and-and do something where I can really help people and-and make a difference.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! What do you do now?

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: I’m a party planner. I’ll see you tomorrow. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! (Joins the rest of the gang.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey guys! Look who’s back! It’s Ray-ray!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Shut up, that was my friend Melissa from college.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She seems really , really fun!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She’s actually very sweet and we used to be very close.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute, she isn’t… She’s not the one who you…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who you what? Who you what?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow? Wow what?! Wow what?! Who you—what?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not a big deal!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They were lovers.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No we weren’t! It was nothing! It was one night, senior year we went to a party, had a lot of sangria and y’know, ended up…kissing for a bit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So that’s two of my wives.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is working on the seating chart while Chandler looks on and Rachel reads.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, so this is where the band is. (Points.) And this is where the bar is. (Points) And all these pins have people’s names on them. (She has pins to show the seating at each of the tables.) And Rach, here you are. (Points to Rachel’s place.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow. Why don’t we just take me (Grabs her pin) and put me with a Manhattan in my hand, talking to the cute bartender. (Puts her pin at the bar and laughs. Monica just glares at her.) These pins aren’t for playing are they?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, the red ones are my guests and the blue ones are yours.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is so sad. I mean, I only have like ten pins.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, relax it’s not a contest. (To Rachel) Certainly not a close one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Rach. (Stares at her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Stop picturing it!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I think that’s it. The seating chart is done. This is our wedding. They all look like they’re having fun don’t they?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, so where are my parents gonna be?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! (Gets up) Let’s see, well…if this is the wedding hall then umm (Walks away) you’re parents will be at home in Queens.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What, they’re not invited?! Oh no, that’s terrible! They’re gonna be crushed!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why would they think they’re invited?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got me. I don’t…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’m sorry. I thought parents were coming! Y’know? Your parents are comin’! Chandler’s parents are comin’! Ross’s parents are comin’!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross’s parents are my parents!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well-well—see? Parents are comin’!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know I think we should invite them.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh please, you just want more blue pins.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well this is just sad!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, all right. Maybe I can fit them in if I just do some rearranging. But uh, Rachel may actually have to sit at the bar!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is not a problem.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe you’ll order a little sangria?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, get out of here! (Jumps back and walks away.)

content.description: [Scene: Ralph Lauren, Rachel is showing Chandler the selection of tuxedos.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So now, these are all the tuxedos that we make and if there’s anything that you like, we can make you a deal. Anything at all. (Grabs a few) But these are the three that Monica pre-approved.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, thanks a lot for hookin’ me up Rach. I want you to know that I want you to attend our wedding as my guest.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m Monica’s maid of honor. Okay? Don’t try to blue pin me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, what’s the deal with these? These-these look nice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh they are nice. We-we custom-make tuxedos for celebrities and then when they’re done with them they just send ‘em back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean like for award shows?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Some of them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean these tuxes have been down the red carpet with people yelling, “Who are you wearing?! You look fabulous!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, might I suggest watching a little more ESPN and a little less E! ?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, who wore those? (Points to the tuxedos.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, well let’s see uh, this one is Tom Brokaw.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not bad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This one is uh Paul O’Neil.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who’s that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He plays for the Yankees. Seriously, ESPN ! Just once and a while, have it on in the background. (Chandler nods and Rachel grabs another tux) Ooh, this one was Pierce Brosnan!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pierce Brosnan?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: 007?! This is James Bond’s tux?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I have to get married in James Bond’s tux!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s a pretty cool tux.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, it’s not just that, I would be England’s most powerful weapon. Jet setting heartbreaker on her majesty’s secret service. A man who fears no one; with a license to kill. (Worried.) Would Monica let me wear this?

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey and Phoebe are moving chess pieces around on the board and hitting the timer at random.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We should really learn how to play the real way. (Moves another piece.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I like our way. Oh! (Grabs a piece and jumps a bunch of Joey’s like in Checkers.) Chess!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nice move.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So Joey, I just hooked Ross and Chandler up with some tuxedos for the wedding: do you need one?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I’m performing the ceremony. I’m not wearing a tux.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what are you going to wear?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Multi-colored robes! Ooh, and maybe a hat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh. Does Monica know about this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Can I please be there when you tell her? (Joey nods yes.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey oh, Rach wait! Do you want to go to a movie tonight?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, y’know what? I can’t. I have to have dinner with that Melissa girl.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can I come?! I won’t even talk! You’ll just hear the noise from my video camera.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What is this? What’s going on?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh good! Can I tell her?! Can I tell her?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, do you want to hear what actually happened or Joey’s lewd version?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey’s!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, come on! I had this friend from college and I made the stupid mistake of telling Joey that one time…she and I y’know…kissed a little bit.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I’m sure that happened.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It-it did!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. (Laughs, then seriously) It happened!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, it was senior year in college. It was after the Sigma Chi luau and Melissa and I got very drunk! And we ended up kissing! For several minutes!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Which means she had a couple spritzers and a quick peck on the cheek.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why are you taking this away from me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, why is it so hard for you to believe?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! I just—I didn’t know that you are a lesbian. (Joey smiles and nods lewdly.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not saying that I’m a lesbian! I’m just saying that this happened!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, it just seems pretty wild and you’re so—y’know so…vanilla.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Vanilla?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not vanilla! I’ve done lots of crazy things! I mean I got-I got drunk and married in Vegas!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: To Ross.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, y’know what? If you don’t want to believe me about this, why don’t you just come with me to dinner tonight and she will tell you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! All right! Yeah! ‘Cause I just can’t picture it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-ho, you should get inside my head.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is on the couch reading as Ross enters carrying a garment bag.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Guess what I got for your wedding! (Holding up his garment bag.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: A freakish thin date with a hanger for her head?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. Rachel hooked me up with a tux! But not just any tux, Batman’s tux!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right! Made expressly for Val Kilmer and worn by him in the hit film…that Batman film he was in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can’t wear that! I’m wearing the famous tux! James Bond’s tux!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So—If you wear that you’ll make mine less special.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, you need something to make this day special? Hello! You-you-you have the most special thing of all! You are marrying the woman you love.
(Chandler mimics him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Please, don’t take away my cool thing. Please?! Pretty please?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pretty please? Not very uh, 007.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, it’s my wedding day okay? If you were getting married I would never do anything to upset you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: When I got married you slept with my sister.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was pretty 007.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is still working on the seating chart as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. Oh good-good you’re here! All right, I figured it out. I’m gonna take two tables of eight, I’m gonna add your parents, and I’m gonna turn them into three tables of six. Okay? And I called the caterer; I added two extra meals, we are good to go!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, they’re not coming.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Somehow they got the idea that you only invited them because of me. They…feel a little unwanted.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s too bad. It’s true, but too bad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look Mon, if you could just call my mom…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on! Look just-just tell—let her know that you really want them to be there. Let’s not forget, this is a woman that has sent you many lasagnas over the years.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No she hasn’t.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is it her fault that some of them didn’t make it to you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, what am I going to say?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. Just uh, just tell ‘em it was a mix-up with the invitations, or—No-no-no! Blame it on the post office. They hate the post office. And the Irish! But I don’t think you can blame it on them, so… (He dials the phone and hands it to Monica.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello? (Listens) Yeah, hi! Mrs. Tribbiani? (Listens) Hi, this is Monica Geller. (Listens) Yeah I’m just calling to say that Chandler and I uh, really hope you can make it to the wedding. Yeah, apparently a bunch of invitations that we sent weren’t delivered. Umm, I guess there was some screw up at the damn post office! (Joey nods his approval.) (Listens) T-Tell me about it! (Listens) Yeah, yeah, the US Post Office? No, more like US lost office! (Listens) What, are they Irish?! (Joey gives her a thumbs up.)

content.description: A restaurant, Melissa, Rachel, and Phoebe are talking.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: …anyway, his name is Allan and we’ve been going out for three years. He was my first client when I became a party planner. He was planning a party for his girlfriend at the time. Oh well. (Rachel and Phoebe politely laugh) And he was Theta Beta Pi at Syracuse.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Oh, that’s great!

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Hmm Phoebe, were you ever in a sorority?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Of course! Yeah, I was uh, umm Thigh Mega Tampon.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: What one?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Y’know, we were really huge too, but then they had to shut us down when Regina Philange died of alcohol poisoning.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Oh, isn’t a shame when one girl ruins it for the whole bunch? (Phoebe agrees by grunting.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anyway, speaking of drinking too much. I was uh, tellin’ Phoebe about that one crazy night after the Sigma Chi luau where you and I uh, we made out.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Remember?! We—come on, we both had the sarongs on, and we had the-the coconut bikini tops…

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …we went back to the house and we got really silly and we…we made out.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Oh wow, Ray-ray I have no idea what you’re talking about.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is on the couch as Chandler disgustedly enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross is Batman!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, he did manage to keep his identity secret for a long time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rachel got Ross the tuxedo that Val Kilmer wore in Batman. Okay Batman is so much cooler than James Bond!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about?! 007 has all those gadgets!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Batman has a utility belt!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: 007 has a fancy car!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Batman has the Batmobile!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: 007 gets all the ladies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Batman has Robin! (Pause) We get ESPN right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How about you go put on your 007 tuxedo and I’ll make you a nice martini.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Actually, I don’t like martinis.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How about a Youhoo with a funny straw?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, yum! (Runs into the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, I know the invitation says 6:00, but does that mean that you want people to get there at six, or the show is gonna start right at six?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The show?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right. Right. The wedding, gotcha. But I mean, it’s gonna start a little late right? I mean, weddings start late. Right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have you ever been to one of my weddings?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah. Yeah. Well look, the thing is it’s the same day as my niece’s christening and I really want my parents to be there in time to see me. ‘Cause my part’s just in the beginning I’m not even in the rest of the show—Wedding!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The wedding starts at six.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Okay, I totally hear ya. Oo how about this? I vamp a little ‘til they get there?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’ll vamp?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Yeah y’know, like warm up the crowd. Ask ‘em where they’re from. ‘Cause in Joey Tribbiani you get a minister and you get an entertainer. I’m a minis-tainer! (Rapping) There is no-one better! There is no-one greater!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How can you not remember us kissing?!

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: I don’t know. I don’t remember a lot of things that never happened.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh… Come on! Remember? We were on the sleeping porch! We couldn’t stop giggling? And our coconuts kept knockin’ together?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, somewhere Joey’s head is exploding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah—but come on—Listen, I’m sorry I don’t want to make you uncomfortable, but I told Phoebe that it happened and she doesn’t believe me.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: I’m sorry Ray-ray. I mean if I thought it happened I would say it. Maybe I passed out and you did stuff to me while I was sleeping.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel, it’s okay. You don’t have to do this. I believe you. All right? Okay, if-if you say that you kissed Melissa, then you kissed Melissa.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you Phoebe.

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: She didn’t.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica and Chandler are working on the seating chart as Ross enters carrying his tux around.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You just carry that around?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. I find it to be something of a conversation piece.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Between you and…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gunther. (To Chandler) Hey-hey! Why don’t we put them on? Y’know get a picture of Batman and James Bond together.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I would but mine doesn’t fit. The pants are a little tight.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A little tight? I could see double-oh and seven in those pants.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well that stinks. I was looking forward to us wearing our celebrity tuxes together.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, does that mean that you’re not going to be wearing yours?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, are you kidding? It’s Batman’s tux!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let me try it on!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, but just the jacket. Double-oh and seven are not gettin’ in there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Holy double-vented comfort Batman! (Finds something in the pocket) What’s this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: An invitation for the At First Sight premiere? Oh my God! Val Kilmer didn’t wear this in Batman! He wore it to the premiere of some tooty-fruity love story where he played a blind guy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let me see that! (Grabs the invitation and reads it.) Oh man!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The only superpower you have is a slightly heightened sense of smell. (Hands him the jacket and walks away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Uh, Monica? Chandler? Can I talk to you guys for a second?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right that’s it, I give up! Whatever you want you can have it! You wanna sing a song? You wanna do a dance? You want your mom to stand at the altar and scream racial slurs? I don’t care!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No, I-I just wanna thank you guys for what you did for my parents, that was really sweet. They’re so happy they get to be a part of your special day.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you’re welcome. And tell them we’re really glad they’re coming.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. I will. Ohh! Check out what they got me to wear for the ceremony! (Runs to his apartment and returns wearing a rather silly hat.) Huh? I wear it like this when I marry you guys, and then this (He tilts it to the side of his head) is for party time.

content.description: Outside the restaurant, Melissa, Phoebe, and Rachel are emerging.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It happened! I am telling you it happened!

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Okay. (To Phoebe) Well, it was great meeting you. And uh Rachel, I-I don’t think I’ll be calling you (hails a cab) because umm, y’know you’ve gotten weird. (The cab pulls up.) Take care you guys.
(She’s about to get in when…)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! Wait a minute! No wait a minute! (She does so.) Okay? Look, that night was the one wild thing I have ever done in my entire life, and I’m not gonna let you take that away from me! Okay, so if you don’t remember that, maybe you will remember this! (She grabs Melissa and kisses her on the lips.)

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: My God! You love me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Of course I remember our kiss. I think about it all the time. I can still hear the coconuts knockin’ together I… (Phoebe is shocked.) I just didn’t want to tell you ‘cause I didn’t think that you’d return my love, and now that you have… (Leans in to kiss Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa! Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! Whoa! Whoa!

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Aww, look who’s being suddenly shy. You can’t tell me you don’t feel what I feel. Nobody can kiss that good and not mean it. (Goes in again.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I-I-I-I’m just…I’m just a good kisser!

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Shut up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry!

content.speaker: Melissa
content.text: Oh you don’t have to be (Laughs again) sorry. I’m…I’m obviously kidding. I’m not in love with you. (To Phoebe) I’m not in love with her. I don’t hear coconuts banging together. Yeah, I don’t…picture your face when I make love to my boyfriend. Anyway, I gotta go. Eh…kiss good-bye? (Rachel stares at her stunned.) No? Okay. (Hurries into the cab and drives off.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! I mean I had no idea that that was gonna…
(Suddenly, Phoebe leans in and kisses her on the lips!)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What the hell was that?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just wanted to see what all the fuss was about.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ve had better.

content.description: [Scene: Ralph Lauren, Rachel is hooking Chandler up with another tuxedo.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! I found one that fits!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well y’know what they say, the 23 rd time’s the charm. (Chandler enters.) Aww, look at you all handsome!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whose is it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh does it matter?! All that matters is that you look so handsome.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whose is it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t want to say.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, come on! I don’t care! Come on! Whose is it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Diane Keaton.
